alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Chester; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chester, York, eastern Cherokee and Union Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1144 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Uptown Charlotte to 3 miles west of Winnsboro. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Union, York, Chester, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Lesslie and Great Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
